data.title: Wrong warn message: Resource file haven\'t set, can\'t find loc string for key: Not pushing metadata as no resource Ids found
data.body:
## Required Information

Recently, we received build warns with `##[warning]Resource file haven\'t set, can\'t find loc string for key: Not pushing metadata as no resource Ids found`. data.title: Azure Key Vault task converts %3B in secrets to ;
data.body:
## Required Information

Entering this information will route you directly to the right team and expedite traction.

**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: Bug

**Enter Task Name**: AzureKeyVault@1 (https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/tree/master/Tasks/AzureKeyVaultV1)

## Environment
- Server - Azure Pipelines
- Agent - Hosted, `windows-2019`

## Issue Description

The Azure Key Vault task is converting all instances of `%3B` in a secret to `;`.

To reproduce, create a secret in a key vault with `%3B` in the value somewhere. Use the Azure Key Vault task to download the secret and observe that all instances of `%3B` in the value are converted to `;`.

For the screenshots below I created a secret with the value `a%3B`:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6156761/89051247-f2da5d80-d321-11ea-92e3-69d8fe25fefd.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6156761/89051324-14d3e000-d322-11ea-9a74-ce39827406af.png)

This issue seems to be isolated to the task because neither the Azure CLI nor the Azure PowerShell commandlets are affected:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6156761/89051523-654b3d80-d322-11ea-87bf-384563bf2f14.png)

### Task logs

data.title: `DotNetCoreCLIV2` should respect `rollForward` in `global.json`

labels.name: backlog
labels.description: Work that is on the backlog and won't get marked stale

data.body:
## Required Information

Entering this information will route you directly to the right team and expedite traction.

**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: Feature

**Enter Task Name**: DotNetCoreCLIV2

## Environment
- Server - Azure Pipelines or TFS on-premises?

Using Azure Pipelines but this isn't environment specific

- Agent - Hosted or Private: 

Using self hosted agents but this isn't environment specific

## Issue Description

When using `DotNetCoreCLIV2` and pulling the information from a `global.json` file, it's not considering [rollForward[(https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/core/tools/global-json?tabs=netcore3x). 
Example, if specifying `"version": "3.1.100"`  with `"rollForward": "latestPatch"`, it should be able to install `3.1.106` (or whichever is the latest at that time)

It might be possible to do something similar using `3.1.x` as a version number, but that doesn't seem to be valid within `global.json`.

data.title: NuGetAuthenticate task should honor DOTNET_CLI_HOME variable

labels.name: aa-backlog
labels.description: Azure Artifacts tag for items under consideration in our backlog.

data.body:
## Note  
Issues in this repo are for tracking bugs, feature requests and questions for the tasks in this repo 

For a list:  
https://github.com/Microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/tree/master/Tasks

If you have an issue or request for the Azure Pipelines service, use developer community instead:  

https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/spaces/21/index.html )

## Required Information

Entering this information will route you directly to the right team and expedite traction.

**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: Bug/Feature

**Enter Task Name**: NuGetAuthenticate

## Environment
- Server - Azure Pipelines or TFS on-premises? Azure Pipelines
    
    - If using TFS on-premises, provide the version: 
    
    - If using Azure Pipelines, provide the account name, team project name, build definition name/build number: https://dev.azure.com/dnceng


- Agent - Hosted or Private: Both, it happens on all agents
    
    - If using Hosted agent, provide agent queue name:

    - If using private agent, provide the OS of the machine running the agent and the agent version: 

## Issue Description

The NuGetAuthenticate task doesn't honor the DOTNET_CLI_HOME environment variable. This variable is used by dotnet cli instead of HOME if it is defined, changing where dotnet cli loads nuget credential plugins from. This breaks authentication to private feeds because the NuGetAuthenticate task installed the credential provider into the HOME directory.

### Task logs

[Enable debug logging and please provide the zip file containing all the logs for a speedy resolution]

## Troubleshooting
Checkout how to troubleshoot failures and collect debug logs: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/vsts/build-release/actions/troubleshooting

### Error logs

[Insert error from the logs here for a quick overview]

data.title: Python Twine Upload Authenticate problem when project contains space in name
data.body:
## Required Information
Question, Bug, or Feature?
Bug

**Enter Task Name**:  Python Twine Authenticate v0/v1

## Environment
Azure Pipelines

## Issue Description
Python Twine Upload Authenticate problem when project contains space in name
current pypirc file created is incompatible with twine.
twine splits index-servers on the space characters Azure project names with spaces result in trying to find
"project" and "name/feed"

I suggest an optional argument to manually set the section name for the index-servers in the .pypirc file 
This can also be used with twine -r

[distutils]
index-servers = project name/feed

[project name/feed]
repository = <first-repository URL>
username = <first-repository username>
password = <first-repository password>

### Task logs

python -m twine upload -r "example_feed" --config-file /home/vsts/work/_temp/twineAuthenticate/zMTT6I/.pypirc /home/vsts/work/1/s/dist/*

InvalidConfiguration: Missing 'project' section from the configuration file
or not a complete URL in --repository-url.
Maybe you have an out-dated '/home/vsts/work/_temp/twineAuthenticate/zMTT6I/.pypirc' format?
more info: https://packaging.python.org/specifications/pypirc/

## Issue Description

data.title: Prevent customers to specify exact version in UsePython / UseRuby tasks

labels.name: awaiting deployment
labels.description: Related changes are waiting for deployment to be completed

data.body:
Hello from https://github.com/actions/virtual-environments.

## Problem  
Both UsePython and UseRuby tasks can't download and install versions on-flight. They just switches between versions pre-installed on image.
On image, we keep only the latest patch version for every major.minor pair.

### Example
Image contains Python 3.6.9. As soon as Python 3.6.10 is released, it will be added to image and will replace Python 3.6.9.
If customer specifies exact version `3.6.9` as task input, they will be **100% BROKEN**.
We should notify customers that they must not to specify exact version and preferred ways are `3` or `3.6`

### Proposed solution
I suggest to print warning if customer specifies version with 3 number like `3.6.9` to both tasks UsePython and UseRuby.
Also I suggest to update documentation for both tasks and add note about it: [UseRuby](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/pipelines/tasks/tool/use-ruby-version?view=azure-devops) and [UsePython](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/pipelines/tasks/tool/use-python-version?view=azure-devops)

UsePython issue could be potentially resolved by https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/issues/13319

EDIT: I think this check makes sense only for Hosted machines since if customer uses self-hosted, he may keep the same patch version forever

data.title: Configurable destination directory for post-job Cache@2 operations
data.body:
## Required Information

**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: Feature

**Task Name**: `Cache@2`  

## Environment

- Server - Azure Pipelines
- Agent - Private

## Issue Description

At the time of writing `Cache@2` task has the following definition:

```
- task: Cache@2
  inputs:
    key: 'MavenCache | $(Agent.OS) | $(Build.SourcesDirectory)/pom.xml'
    restoreKeys: |
      MavenCache | $(Agent.OS)
    path: '/whatever/the/path/to/the/cache/is'
```

In order to make the cache reusable, Azure pipelines trigger `Post-job: Cache` step to package up directory specified as `path` property. The process looks as follows:

```
ApplicationInsightsTelemetrySender will correlate events with X-TFS-Session <whatever/>
Getting a pipeline cache artifact with one of the following fingerprints:
Fingerprint: `MavenCache|Linux|TJgax8G8hfQnjVpIgWsMY/g4TxOPHkzlo+BX5ekdv70=`
There is a cache miss.
Process exit code: 0
DedupManifestArtifactClient will correlate http requests with X-TFS-Session <whatever/>
1 files processed.
Processed 1 files from /tmp successfully.
Uploading 1 files from directory /tmp.
Uploaded 6,111,824 out of 426,229,760 bytes.
Uploaded 17,781,594 out of 426,229,977 bytes
Content upload is done!
```

I assume that `Cache@2` does something similar to `tar czf /tmp/<some_id>_archive.tar /whatever/the/path/to/the/cache/is`. The issue here is that `/tmp` may not have enough space to accommodate the `.tar` file, which effectively means unexpected error at the very end of pipeline processing:

```
tar: db923fbbd4944b7cb1960f5a5a979e17_archive.tar: Wrote only 2048 of 10240 bytes
tar: Error is not recoverable: exiting now
```

In my particular case, there's plenty of space available on other mount points, which I'd like to utilize. Of course the issue can be solved by adjusting filesystem layout and allocating more space to `/tmp`, but it not always possible and convenient to do.

### Task logs

See above

### Error logs

data.title: Improve UsePython to allow installation versions on-flight
data.body:
## Problem  
Currently, UsePython task just switches versions that are pre-cached on image ([example](https://github.com/actions/virtual-environments/blob/main/images/win/Windows2019-Readme.md#python)).

It works for the most of the use-cases, because image always contains latest patch version for every major.minor pair.
However, some customers prefer to specify exact version of Python and would like to control it by themselves / freeze specific version. Current implementation of UsePython doesn't allow it.

## Proposal
Versions of Python can be installed on-flight from https://github.com/actions/python-versions. This repo distributes versions of Python via GH releases. Also it contains `versions-manifest.json` as an index of versions.

Installation on-flight is pretty quick and should cover those use-cases. Also it is not a breaking change because task will try to download version only in case if it is not found locally.

The same changes were already done for GitHub Actions task [setup-python](https://github.com/actions/setup-python).
Related PRs:
1) https://github.com/actions/setup-python/pull/85
2) https://github.com/actions/toolkit/pull/382

When re-running a build with no code changes, the pipeline started failing on the VSBuild task with the following error:

msbuildArgs: >

Works as

msbuildArgs: /t:Build /p:NpmInstallCommand="npm install --only=dev" /p:MvcBuildViews=true
```

Again, this seemed to happen without any changes, Not should if there have been updates to the tasks or agents within the last 24 hours.

data.title: PublishSymbolsV2: Support source indexing across git submodules
data.body:
## Required Information

Entering this information will route you directly to the right team and expedite traction.

**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*:  Feature

**Enter Task Name**: PublishSymbolsV2

## Issue Description

I have a pipeline for building an open source project, where the project does not have Azure DevOps YAML build definitions built-in. In order to simplify synchronizing between upstream and downstream forks, the open-source repository is forked with no build-specific modifications. Instead, the build definition is hosted in a separate repository, with the main code included as a git submodule.

This works very well, *except* that source indexing doesn't work. The contents of the SrcSrv script embedded in the PDB will only use the build-initiating repository as the source of any file loading requests. As a result, all source lookups will fail.

It'd be awesome if the task was able to support multiple repo/commit pairs, and supported mapping different files to different repos in the file list. I'd be willing to accept it if I had to provide the submodule repo/commit values, and paths to the submodules in the task configuration, but in an ideal world, the task would be able to query that information from git directly.

data.title: PublishTestResult + NUnit3 report: publishing of test attachments with relative path not working
data.body:
Should it be possible to publish the test attachments with a relative path in Azure DevOps for NUnit3 reports?
 
The task is configured like this:
 
```yml
- task: PublishTestResult@2
   inputs:
     testResultsFormat: 'NUnit'
     testResultsFiles: 'tmp/report.xml'
     publishRunAttachments: true
```
The report looks like this:
 
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?>
<test-run>
    <test-suite type="Assembly" name="...">
        <-- ... -->
        <test-case name="..." result="Failed" duration="24.161">
            <failure>
                <message>
                    ...
                </message>
                <stack-trace>
                    ...
                </stack-trace>
            </failure>
            <attachments>
                <attachment>
                    <filePath>tmp/screenshots/errors/1.png</filePath>
                </attachment>
            </attachments>
        </test-case>
    </test-suite>
</test-run>
```

It seems that the file can not be found, even tough it is in the given location relative to $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory):
```
##[warning]Skipping attachment as it is not available on disk: tmp/screenshots/errors/1.png
```

Is the search folder (default: $(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)) not taken into consideration for attachments?
Should attachment path be absolute?
I also tried it on linux and windows build agents.
I can not find information about this in the docs:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/pipelines/tasks/test/publish-test-results?view=azure-devops&tabs=yaml#nunit-3

data.title: DockerV2: Task ignores addPipelineData and always sets two labels on build
data.body:
## Required Information

Entering this information will route you directly to the right team and expedite traction.

**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: Bug

**Enter Task Name**: DockerV2 
https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/tree/master/Tasks/DockerV2

## Environment
- Server - Azure Pipelines
    
- Agent - Hosted: 
    
    - Image: ubuntu-18.04
    - Pool: Azure Pipelines

## Issue Description

[Include task name(s), screenshots and any other relevant details]

By default the Docker Task (build/push/build and push) sets pipeline metadata as labels. This can be deactivated by setting **addPipelineData: false** in the pipelines.yml definition.

Unfortunately, even after deactivating this explicitly, two labels remain present in the build result. The labels in question are `build.sourceversion` and `teamfoundationcollectionuri`. While I don't have a problem with the former, the name and address of the Project Collection is not something I would like to pass around as public data. 

Right now there dont seem to be any way to remove these labels other than executing another docker build via the CLI and overwriting/erasing the _unwanted_ labels.

Pipeline metadata is disabled: 

``` yaml
- task: Docker@2
displayName: 'build docker image'
inputs:
  command: build
  Dockerfile: $(workdir)/src/web/Dockerfile
  buildContext: $(workdir)/src/web
  addPipelineData: false
```

The resulting image metadata contains these two labels:
```
LABEL com.azure.dev.image.build.sourceversion=....
LABEL com.azure.dev.image.system.teamfoundationcollectionuri=https://dev.azure.com/.../
```

The issue is that the pipeline task ignores the value of `addPipelineData`.

Offending line (for `teamfoundationcollectionuri`):
https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/blob/714e68f75c1e56ca699f6514700c5824cd231079/Tasks/Common/docker-common-v2/pipelineutils.ts#L23

The task also sets the build.sourceversion label. This is done in [pipelineutils.ts line #31](https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/blob/714e68f75c1e56ca699f6514700c5824cd231079/Tasks/Common/docker-common-v2/pipelineutils.ts#L31)


### Task logs

```
Step 16/17 : LABEL com.azure.dev.image.build.sourceversion=e75b414***************0fdef0388ce7550e
 ---> Running in c557bf5ded0a
Removing intermediate container c557bf5ded0a
 ---> 38ee50360568
Step 17/17 : LABEL com.azure.dev.image.system.teamfoundationcollectionuri=https://dev.azure.com/<Project_Collection_Name>/
```

### Expected behavior

I expect that the Task respects my choice and disabling pipeline metadata actually disables pipeline metadata.

data.title: NpmAuthenticateV0 should write token to ~/.npmrc to works with NPX and match vsts-npm-auth

labels.name: aa-backlog
labels.description: Azure Artifacts tag for items under consideration in our backlog.

data.body:
## Required Information

*Type*: bug

**Enter Task Name**: NpmAuthenticateV0

## Environment

Server: Azure Pipelines
Agent: Hosted (Windows 2016)

## Issue Description

When running "NPM authenticate", it write to the local `.npmrc` file (the file we pass as task argument). But `vsts-npm-auth` write to `~/.npmrc` by default.

Both case works for `npm install`. But `NpmAuthenticateV0` will fail when running `npx`.

I believe the auth token should be written to `~/.npmrc` to enable `npx`. And this also aligns with `vsts-npm-auth` behavior as well.

### Repro

1. Build an empty pipeline, source code repos can be empty
1. Add a command line task
   ```sh
   md test
   cd test
   echo registry=https://XXX.pkgs.visualstudio.com/_packaging/XXX/npm/registry/>.npmrc
   echo always-auth=true>>.npmrc
   ```
1. Add a NPM Authenticate task
   - Authenticate `test/.npmrc` file
1. Add another command line task
   ```sh
   cd test
   type .npmrc
   echo {}>package.json
   npx -p "p-defer" -c "echo Hello!"
   ```

### Expected result

In the second command line task, it will print the `.npmrc` file with the content:

```
registry=https://XXX.pkgs.visualstudio.com/_packaging/XXX/npm/registry/
always-auth=true

//XXX.pkgs.visualstudio.com/_packaging/XXX/npm/registry/:_authToken=***
```

We can verify the token is in `.npmrc`.

The next step is `npx -p p-defer -c "echo Hello!"`, which essentially means: install `p-defer` package then run `echo Hello!`. Any package is fine, I am just putting `p-defer` here because it install quickly with zero dependencies.

But when `npx` is being called, it will fail with E401:

```
npm ERR! code E401
npm ERR! Unable to authenticate, need: Bearer authorization_uri=https://login.windows.net/12345678-1234-5678-abcd-12345678abcd, Basic realm="https://pkgsprodeus99.pkgs.visualstudio.com/", TFS-Federated

npm ERR! A complete log of this run can be found in:
npm ERR!     C:\Users\JohnDoe\AppData\Roaming\npm-cache\_logs\2020-07-10T21_13_58_727Z-debug.log
Install for [ 'p-defer@latest' ] failed with code 1
```

This is because `npx` cannot get the auth token from the local `./.npmrc` file, but it was asked to authenticate against a custom registry. Thus, it end up with E401.

If the auth token is stored in `~./npmrc`, `npx` will run successfully because it can read from the auth token.

Note: the empty `package.json` is critical for the repro. If left out, `npx` will ignore the `./.npmrc` file.

### Task logs

I believe the expected result section above is sufficient.

## Troubleshooting

### Error logs

I believe the expected result section above is sufficient.

data.title: Documentation: AzureFileCopyV4 output variable documentation incomplete
data.body:
## Required Information

Entering this information will route you directly to the right team and expedite traction.

**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: Bug

documentation issue

**Enter Task Name**: AzureFileCopyV4  

list here (V# not needed):  
https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/tree/master/Tasks/AzureFileCopyV4

## Environment
- Server - Azure Pipelines
   
    
    - If using Azure Pipelines, provide the account name, team project name, build definition name/build number: n/a


- Agent - Hosted or Private: 
    
    - If using Hosted agent, provide agent queue name: windows-latest

## Issue Description

The [AzureFileCopyV4](https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/tree/master/Tasks/AzureFileCopyV4) task has poor documentation on working with its output variables. In v3, the variables outputted were task inputs. In v4, they are created as [output variables](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/pipelines/process/variables?view=azure-devops&tabs=yaml%2Cbatch#use-output-variables-from-tasks) (and not defined in the task ui). The documentation between v3 and v4 does not change in any way to reflect this.

You have to know to dig into the [task code](https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/blob/master/Tasks/AzureFileCopyV4/AzureFileCopy.ps1#L197) to find out that the output variables are titled:

- StorageContainerUri
- StorageContainerSasToken

Following the [output variables](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/pipelines/process/variables?view=azure-devops&tabs=yaml%2Cbatch#use-output-variables-from-tasks) documentation, we can then reference the variables like so:

```
- task: AzureFileCopy@4
  inputs:
    SourcePath: 'Readme.md'
    azureSubscription: 'Test'
    Destination: 'AzureBlob'
    storage: 'azdo'
    ContainerName: 'workshops'
    BlobPrefix: ''
  name: AzureFileCopy
- script: | 
    echo $(AzureFileCopy.StorageContainerUri)
    echo $(AzureFileCopy.StorageContainerSasToken)
```

I can submit a PR for the readme update if desired.   Thanks

N/a

n/a

n/a

## Issue Description

I am using `NpmAuthenticateV0` to authenticate to my Azure Artifact Feed.
When I run `NpmAuthenticateV0` on my `.npmrc` file, it gives me the following warning:
```
##[warning]Found and overrode credentials for the {org}.pkgs.visualstudio.com registry in the selected .npmrc file. Remove credentials from the file and store them in an npm service connection instead (recommended), or remove the npm Authenticate task from your build to use credentials checked into an .npmrc.

It seems `NpmAuthenticateV0` authenticates twice for the same registry URL.

NpmAuthenticateV0 task:

- task: npmAuthenticate@0
  displayName: 'NPM Authenticate'

```

.npmrc (The URL of `registry` is the same as the URL of `@myscope:registry`)

@myscope:registry=https://{org}.pkgs.visualstudio.com/_packaging/{project}/npm/registry/
always-auth=true
```

## Expected Behavior

The warning should be suppressed since I was authenticating the same registry at the second time.

data.title: Download Pipeline Artifact Ignores http_proxy for HTTPS
data.body:
Not sure if this is a fault of the download pipeline artifact task (for ignoring `http_proxy`) or the fault of the VSTS Agent for not passing `https_proxy` on but I have described the issue in full [here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/62757233/download-artifact-fails-ignoring-http-proxy).

Basically the download of any artifact fails UNLESS we explicitly set `https_proxy`. This was reproduced on versions `2.165.0`, `2.169.0` and `2.171.0` of the agent on CentOS 7. The task version is `1.2.5`.

It seems the task is unable to see the proxy confgured for the agent because it only get's `http_proxy` and no `https_proxy` is provided. Arguably the task needs to either respect `http_proxy` for HTTPS URIs (like other software does) or the Agent Team is going to have to provide `https_proxy`.

data.title: Cache@2 allows relative paths for 'Path of the folder to cache' but fails uploading the cache
data.body:
## Required Information

**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
Bug

**Enter Task Name**: Cache

## Environment
- Agent - Hosted or Private: 
    Hosted agent (2019 windows server image)
    Sample build [here](https://dev.azure.com/ms/react-native-windows/_build/results?buildId=91831&view=logs&jobId=d1d6f0bf-8fba-5a08-054d-b7f8f3ed7bef&j=d1d6f0bf-8fba-5a08-054d-b7f8f3ed7bef)    

## Issue Description
The [docs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/pipelines/tasks/utility/cache?view=azure-devops) states that the path can be relative, and that relative paths would be relative against: `$(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)` 
When using a relative cache location like `/.yarnCache` to have a relative path rooted at the drive, there is no configuration error, but the folders used are not relative to the specified paths...
This [build](https://dev.azure.com/ms/react-native-windows/_build/results?buildId=91831&view=logs&jobId=d1d6f0bf-8fba-5a08-054d-b7f8f3ed7bef&j=d1d6f0bf-8fba-5a08-054d-b7f8f3ed7bef) in job "Extra Steps" shows in task [`Check vars`](https://dev.azure.com/ms/react-native-windows/_build/results?buildId=91831&view=logs&jobId=d1d6f0bf-8fba-5a08-054d-b7f8f3ed7bef&j=d1d6f0bf-8fba-5a08-054d-b7f8f3ed7bef&t=a9d0a711-010f-5f5e-6201-b180e3b36e8c) that the `$(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)` is `d:\a\1\s` So I would expect the yarn cache to be `d:\.yarnCache`
This seems to be what happens in the yarn command. Unfortunately the cache task does not display the fully resolved cache location, so I'm assuming that it did the steps per the documentation...

The problem occurs in the `Post-job: Cache Yarn packages` task, where the relative path is resolved to `c:\.yarnCache`

data.title: Azure File Copy task creates anonymously accessible containers by default
data.body:
## Note  
Issues in this repo are for tracking bugs, feature requests and questions for the tasks in this repo 

For a list:  
https://github.com/Microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/tree/master/Tasks

If you have an issue or request for the Azure Pipelines service, use developer community instead:  

https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/spaces/21/index.html )

## Required Information

Entering this information will route you directly to the right team and expedite traction.

**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: Question

**Enter Task Name**: Azure File Copy  

list here (V# not needed):  
https://github.com/Microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/tree/master/Tasks

## Environment
- Server - Azure Pipelines or TFS on-premises?
    
    - If using TFS on-premises, provide the version: 
    
    - If using Azure Pipelines, provide the account name, team project name, build definition name/build number: 


- Agent - Hosted or Private: 
Hosted
Image: vs2017-win2016
Agent: Azure Pipelines 5

## Issue Description

I recently upgraded a task the Azure File Copy task from v1 to v4 and noticed a change in behavior. I'm using the task to copy files to an Azure Storage Account. The container that gets created has its 'Public Access Level' attribute set to 'Container' whereas the older version was setting it to 'Private'. The consequence is that anyone having (or guessing) the container URI gets access to the container. Since the task also generates a time-constrained SAS Token, I doubt that anonymous access to the container is really intended.

Digging a little bit in the code, I noticed that the Create-AzureContainer function will set the permission to 'Container' is the storage account is not premium. If it is premium, the default permission ('Private') is used. I don't see a compelling reason to tie security option to the performance characteristics of the Storage Account.
https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/blob/master/Tasks/AzureFileCopyV4/AzureUtilityAz1.0.ps1, lines 57-59

To sum it up, my questions are: is it intended to create the blob container with anonymous access by default or is this a bug? Is there a way to change this behavior and the create private containers instead?

### Task logs

[Enable debug logging and please provide the zip file containing all the logs for a speedy resolution]

## Troubleshooting

data.title: Consider making the execution of the Cache post-job step configurable
data.body:
## Required Information

Entering this information will route you directly to the right team and expedite traction.

**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: Feature

**Enter Task Name**: Cache 

## Environment
- Server - Azure Pipelines
Account: ledgerscope
Project: Core
Build: CI
Build Id: 23425
    
- Agent - Hosted 
    
    - If using Hosted agent, provide agent queue name: Azure Pipelines

## Issue Description

We have a single CI build which runs 2 different Jobs in parallel for each commit. We're using caching to reduce the amount of time we spend downloading dependencies. When the cache key changes, there is frequently a race condition when updating the cache at the end of the Job because the builds take a near-identical amount of time to run. They both check for the presence of the key, but as it takes 30 seconds to update the cache, they end up both uploading it (or at least doing the work for it).

This doesn't cause a problem (as far as I'm aware), it just means that the Job is doing more work than it needs to.

Would it be possible to make the Cache Task configurable so that (for example) we could ensure that only one of the Jobs is responsible for updating the cache if there was a cache miss?

data.body:
*Type*: Bug

**Enter Task Name**: NuGetAuthenticate

https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/tree/master/Tasks/NuGetAuthenticateV0

## Environment
- Server - Azure Pipelines or TFS on-premises? Azure Pipelines 
   Account Name: DevDiv
   Team Project Name: Concord
   Build Definition Name (Build Number): Concord-Windows-PR (11789)

- Agent - Private Windows (2.165.0)

## Issue Description
The error seen is:
```
[error]Error: Failed to remove the directory 'C:\Users\dlab14\.nuget\plugins\netfx\CredentialProvider.Microsoft' while installing the credential provider. Ensure that this directory is not in use and that the agent account has permission to delete this directory.
Error: EPERM: operation not permitted, unlink 'C:\Users\dlab14\.nuget\plugins\netfx\CredentialProvider.Microsoft\PowerArgs.dll'
```
This is due to:
Basically the bug is that if `forceReinstallCredentialProvider`  == true, the task should kill their own running exe before trying to overwrite DLLs its loaded and it itself.  That or maybe it was supposed to exit on its own, one of those is the bug.

data.title: Publishing Azure Function doesn't work in agent behind proxy
data.body:
Entering this information will route you directly to the right team and expedite traction.

**Question, Bug, or Feature?** : Bug
**Enter Task Name**: AzureFunctionAppV1

## Environment
- Server - Azure Pipelines or TFS on-premises? Azure DevOps Server
    
    - If using TFS on-premises, provide the version: Version Dev17.M153.5
    
- Agent - Hosted or Private: 
    
    - If using private agent, provide the OS of the machine running the agent and the agent version: 
OS: Windows Server 2012 R2
Agent Version: 2.153.1

## Issue Description

Get a proxy authentication error (407 status code).  Have tried setting environment variable HTTPS_PROXY=http://user:password@our.proxy.co.nz which sorted the terraform task, but not this one.

data.title: Searching for best practices
data.body:
## Required Information
*Type*: Question
**Enter Task Name**: DotNetCoreCLI@2

## Environment
- Server - Azure Pipelines 
- Agent - Private: vsts-agent-win-x64-2.166.4

## Issue Description
Hello, 
I am sorry if this isnt the best place to ask questions but Im so confused, I dont know where to go anymore.

My task seems simple:
- Developers used GitHub to create a DotNetCore command prompt application
- I was asked to use Azure Pipelines to get the code from GitHub to a self-hosted agent
- Build the project, zip the binaries and move the zip file to Azure artefact 
- Build an Azure Release to get the latest version and extract the files to an intranet server accessible from the agent.

As we have firewall constraints we have setup a feed with an upstream source and a feed for our artifacts

I couldnt restore from a build command, I had to do a NuGet Restore first:
- task: NuGetCommand@2
  inputs:
    command: 'restore'
    restoreSolution: '$(solution)'
    feedsToUse: 'select'
    vstsFeed: '33706eec--b948878fd368'
    verbosityRestore:  'Detailed'
    includeNuGetOrg: false

Next, I built my project: 
- task: DotNetCoreCLI@2
  inputs:
    command: 'build'
    projects: '$(solution)'
    arguments: '-o $(Build.BinariesDirectory) --configuration $(buildConfiguration)'
    feedsToUse: 'select'
    vstsFeed: '33706eec--b948878fd368'
    includeNuGetOrg: false

I simply wanted to push the zip file to my feed but I had first to add a nuget.config then I tried the below task: 
- task: DotNetCoreCLI@2
  inputs:
    command: 'push'
    packagesToPush: '$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)/filename_$(Build.BuildId).zip'
    nuGetFeedType: 'internal'
    publishVstsFeed: '33706eec--add95b24fdfd'
    publishPackageMetadata: false

It requested a NuGet package file so I tried to create one with:
- task: CmdLine@2
  displayName: 'Build package'
  inputs:
    script: dotnet pack --no-build --no-restore $(solution) -o $(Build.BinariesDirectory) /p:OutputPath=$(Build.ArtifactStagingDirectory)

It failed as this file is missing: .runtimeconfig.json

Could you please help me to find the best way to achieve my goal?  It seems to me that I dont need to create packages as if it was to be given to the world, I only need to push the file but maybe it was not meant for that or I dont see the full picture.

If you could help me or point me in the right direction, that would be so great!!!!

Thanks a lot, 
Claude

data.title: File transform cannot replace variable called "build"
data.body:
## Required Information

**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: Bug

**Enter Task Name**: File transform  

list here (V# not needed):  
https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/tree/master/Tasks/FileTransform

## Environment
- Server - Azure Pipelines 

- Agent - windows-2019

## Issue Description

When building an electron.NET application, I want to transform some things in a file called "electron.manifest.json". 

Those values are located in the nested variable called build, here I want to change the "appId"

```

{
    "build": {
        "appId" : "valueHere"
    }
}

```

In my pipeline I define a variable called "build.appId" as recommended by the fileTransform's doc. 

In the task log, it does find the file and changes some other values (not nested in "build") but it seems to ignore those that are in "build".

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14331639/85376149-a4be8700-b537-11ea-884a-8a79089d100c.png)

data.title: Azure SQL Database Deployment task - Server/DataBase/Login names need to support secrets
data.body:
## Required Information
**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: Bug

**Enter Task Name**: Azure SQL Database Deployment

https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/tree/master/Tasks/SqlAzureDacpacDeploymentV1

## Environment
- Server - Azure Pipelines

- Agent - Hosted: windows-latest

## Issue Description

The fields passed into this task such as... 

_**_Azure SQL Server
Database
Login_**_

...should all allow the passing of a variable as a secret. These details are as security sensitive as the password for just about every organisation.

## [error]
**Server name '***' is not in the correct format. Use a fully qualified domain name format like 'yyy.database.windows.net'**

data.title: Can I filter projects using "command: test" in task DotNetCoreCLI@2?
data.body:
## Required Information
**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: Question

**Enter Task Name**: DotNetCoreCLI@2  

This is my task:
```
  - task: DotNetCoreCLI@2
    displayName: Run unit tests
    inputs:
      command: "test"
      projects: "**/*.Test.csproj;!**/*.TestX.csproj"
```

I tried that and I get the warning in the logs.

    ##[warning]Project file(s) matching the specified pattern were not found.

So apparently the command `test` doesn't support filters.

Is that right?

data.title: DownloadPipelineArtifact Cancelled after 20min well over 100%
data.body:
## Required Information
As described [here](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/1067515/etimeout-on-nodetool.html) we are seeing download tasks fail in weird ways across different platforms, agents and even across YAML or Classic Pipelines.

**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: Bug

**Enter Task Name**: DownloadPipelineArtifact

## Environment
- Server - Azure Pipelines    
    - Account: buhlergroup
    - Project: myBhler
    - Pipeline: images-build-new (YAML)
    - Build Id: 80854
- Agent - Private: 
    - ecom-app02-dev
    - Windows

## Issue Description

The Download task runs to >100% (e.g. 230%) then fails. Checking the server it seems the Artifact has been downloaded but the Agent is confused and gives up after 20min.

Interestingly we are seeing similar weird behaviour with the NodeJS task. We are behind a firewall and proxy but we have failry convincingly excluded this as a problem by watching the traffic and seeing it pass through.

data.title: Can't execute Inline PowerShell scripts with enabled Deviceguard
data.body:
## Required Information

**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: Bug

**Enter Task Name**: PowerShell task (V1 and V2)  

## Environment
Server: TFS on-premise      
Microsoft Visual Studio Team Foundation Server Version 16.131.28601.4
also tried with Azure DevOps 2019 Update 1 Dev17.M153.5

## Agent Version and Platform
2.131.0 but also tested with latest 2.170.0

## OS of the machine running the agent

Windows 10 IoT Enterprise 2016 LTSB (10.0.14393) **with active DEVICEGUARD**

## Issue Description

For testing under realistic conditions we must test our software with enabled DeviceGuard. By doing so, PowerShell itself is run in "constrained language mode".
Now when the VSTS agent wants to execute our scripts from a PowerShell task (V1 or V2 doesn't matter),
it fails because dot-sourcing does not work with enabled constrained language mode.

We observed this issue in several locations where PowerShell is invoked, for example

`[2020-06-04 11:20:40Z INFO ProcessInvokerWrapper] Arguments: '-NoLogo -Sta -NoProfile -NonInteractive -ExecutionPolicy Unrestricted -Command ". ([scriptblock]::Create(...`

This happens at least in the **ProcessInvokerWrapper** and **StepsRunner** (see detailed log below).

## Reproducer

- Setup a machine with VSTS agent
- Enable DeviceGuard on the machine
- Setup a Release Definition with an Environment
- Add an Agent Phase that has a single inline PowerShell Task (Write-Host "Hello World") and uses the agent
- Create Release

Outcome: The release will fail with the error messages shown in the log below.

## Proposed Patch

Check all locations where PowerShell scripts are invoked and
use "& [Script]" instead of ". [Script]".

Additionally, if there are PowerShell scripts generated on the fly, please avoid dot-sourcing, too.

Best regards, Dominic

data.title: dotnet test eats quotes in TestRunParameters
data.body:
## Note  
Issues in this repo are for tracking bugs, feature requests and questions for the tasks in this repo 

For a list:  
https://github.com/Microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/tree/master/Tasks

If you have an issue or request for the Azure Pipelines service, use developer community instead:  

https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/spaces/21/index.html )

## Required Information

Entering this information will route you directly to the right team and expedite traction.

**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: Bug

**Enter Task Name**: DotNetCoreCLI@2

list here (V# not needed):  
https://github.com/Microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/tree/master/Tasks

## Environment
- Server - Azure Pipelines or TFS on-premises?
Azure pipelines
    
    - If using TFS on-premises, provide the version: 
    
    - If using Azure Pipelines, provide the account name, team project name, build definition name/build number: 


- Agent - Hosted or Private: 
    
    - If using Hosted agent, provide agent queue name:

    - If using private agent, provide the OS of the machine running the agent and the agent version: 

## Issue Description

```yaml
- task: DotNetCoreCLI@2
  inputs:
    command: 'test'
    arguments: '-- TestRunParameters.Parameter(name=%22EdiStagingFunctionsKey%22,value=%22key2%22) TestRunParameters.Parameter(name=%22EdiAADKey%22,value=%22key1%22)'
```
This is the only way I am able to pass TestRunParameters to the run. This was reported here: https://github.com/microsoft/vstest/issues/2387 and the escaping was fixed in vstest and dotnet sdk, but some additional rules are applied on the AzDO task side. Because for example \\ is replaced by / and quotes are eaten by the task. So it is not true that what works on the command line works in the task (mentioned here https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/issues/10712#issuecomment-552195220 ) and none of the approaches described there worked for me, except for providing the quotes as URL escapes `%22`.

Ideally the user would be able to copy paste from the command line, where `\"` is the way to escape the quotes properly.

### Task logs

https://dev.azure.com/jajares/params/_build?definitionId=6&_a=summary

## Troubleshooting
Checkout how to troubleshoot failures and collect debug logs: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/vsts/build-release/actions/troubleshooting

### Error logs

[Insert error from the logs here for a quick overview]

data.title: Azure SQL Database deployment task : Include token based authentication for dacpac deployment
data.body:
## Note  
Requesting new feature for Azure SQL Database deployment task, when AuthenticationType is set to aadAuthenticationIntegrated. DACPAC deployment work only if ARM service connection was having users id and password auth. It does not work if ARM Service connection is based on SPN. 

At present, we generate token for https://database.windows.net to deploy dacpac file by passing additional parameter to SqlPackage.exe. Is it possible to include this token generation internally if the service connection is based on SPN.

Reference link:  
https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/blob/master/Tasks/SqlAzureDacpacDeploymentV1/task.json
https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/blob/3ebee401e9838788f0faae53e8b32c08af894806/Tasks/SqlAzureDacpacDeploymentV1/SqlAzureActions.ps1
https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/blob/961d90a3b8d4390ea62066ff601a0c3fbc8ea538/Tasks/SqlAzureDacpacDeploymentV1/Utility.ps1

## Required Information

Entering this information will route you directly to the right team and expedite traction.

**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: Feature

**Task Name**: Azure SQL Database deployment

Source Code (V1 not needed):  
https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/tree/master/Tasks/SqlAzureDacpacDeploymentV1

## Environment
- Server - Azure Pipelines

## Issue Description
When AuthenticationType is set to aadAuthenticationIntegrated. DACPAC deployment work only if ARM service connection was having users id and password auth. It does not work if ARM Service connection is based on SPN.

data.title: Custom naming of shared service connections
data.body:
## Required Information

Entering this information will route you directly to the right team and expedite traction.

**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: Feature

## Issue Description

When sharing a service connection with another project, I'd very much appreciate the ability to provide the name for the shared service connection at the same time. Currently, the name is hardcoded to be a copy of the service connection name being shared but with the destination project name appended to it. We then have to go to each project individually and rename them manually which oddly requires a very high-level permission set. It would save a lot of time and improved security if a name could be provided during the sharing process.

data.title: Shared service connections requires Azure RoleAssignments.Write permission to rename
data.body:
## Required Information

Entering this information will route you directly to the right team and expedite traction.

**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: Question

## Issue Description

Editing a shared service connection, such as simply renaming it after sharing it, requires the Microsoft.Authorization/roleassignments/write access on the Azure subscription that the service connection provides access to. Even though the user is the Project Administrator for the DevOps project, they are unable to rename the shared service connection that is shared with their own project. I'm curious why this permission is required and if there is any way to remove or work around this. It really seems odd that such a increased global-level permission is required for such a simple rename of a project level item.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8837910/84206190-7cc52300-aa63-11ea-836d-805683b168f4.png)

data.title: PublishCodeCoverageResults has misleading warning and documentation?
data.body:
## Required Information

Entering this information will route you directly to the right team and expedite traction.

**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: **Question**

**Enter Task Name**: Publish Code Coverage

list here (V# not needed):  
https://github.com/Microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/tree/master/Tasks

## Issue Description

Is the documentation misleading for this particular task? I've found that it says that if you provide multiple reports for this task it won't merge them (See here: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/pipelines/tasks/test/publish-code-coverage-results?view=azure-devops#faq)
Even there's a warning when the task is executed with multiple files.
But in reality, I'm seeing this:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5412470/84192367-7d5bba80-aa5f-11ea-83be-cf40252df123.png)
[...]netcoreapp2.0\ReportGenerator.dll -reports:tests/**/coverage.cobertura.xml -targetdir:d:\Agent2\_work\_temp\cchtml -reporttypes:HtmlInline_AzurePipelines
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5412470/84192421-95cbd500-aa5f-11ea-9b84-7629fb62d7cd.png)

It seems that under the hood, the tasks uses the ReportGenerator package, which is actually merging my reports.

So, the questions are:
- **Is the warning misleading?**
- **Is there a need to update the docs somehow to let the users know that their reports are actually being merged?**

I'm asking this, because this is a **desired behaviour**.

Thanks!

data.title: AzurePowerShell task - variable links to PS1 files
data.body:
## Required Information

**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: Feature

**Enter Task Name**: AzurePowerShell

## Issue Description
I've invested some effort to unify pipelines of several products/repos into a collection of universal scripts. Our pipelines are run on Self-Hosted server, my scripts are stored in specific folder outside agent root. I am going to clone pipelines for individual projects, but the path to my scripts has to be hardcoded. If the path changes, it will have to be updated in all clones as well. The total number is pretty high.

Currently the path can't contain environment variable. Would it be possible to support this? This is my preferred approach. The server runs on Windows so that env. var would have to follow Windows notation %VAR%. For other OSes this should follow their conventions.

I've also tried to create a shortcut in the C.\ folder pointing to PS1 file in different folder hoping this hardcoded path is less likely to break. No, this fails.

Another approach is to specify some organization-wide variable and use in PS1 path. 

Any support for dynamic paths is highly appreciated.

data.title: Publishing universal package doesn't work in Self-Hosted agent behind proxy
data.body:
Hi, 
I'm using 'Universal Packages' publish task in release pipeline in self-hosted agent which is behind proxy. During run I'm getting error:

**Error: tunneling socket could not be established, statusCode=403**

I had similar problem on 'Download Artifacts' step, but below solution resolved the issue (defining 'release.artifact.download.useagentplugin' variable with 'true' value). 
https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/439174/self-hosted-agents-behind-proxy-cannot-download-bu.html

I cannot find any similar solution for 'Universal Packages' publish task

data.title: PublishTestResults@2 version 2.170.0 fails to upload tasks due to missing PTR_TEST_RUNSUMMARY.json file
data.body:
**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
Bug

**Enter Task Name**: PublishTestResults@2

## Environment
- Server - Azure Pipelines
    - If using Azure Pipelines, provide the account name, team project name, build definition name/build number: 
    Account: MQAutomate
    Team Project Name: MOSAIQLab
    Build Definition Name: Prereq Test
    Build number - all

- Agent - Private (VM Environment) on Windows Servers: 
    
## Issue Description
Task version `2.170.0` fails to upload tasks, even though it completes successfully.

"Normal" log:
```
C:\azagent\A1\_work\_tasks\PublishTestResults_0b0f01ed-7dde-43ff-9cbb-e48954daf9b1\2.170.0\modules\TestResultsPublisher.exe @C:\azagent\A1\_work\_temp\40166ab0-a773-11ea-b9d3-91ff84b586bc.txt 
Finishing: Upload test reports 
```

With diagnostic logs on, we see the following:
```
##[debug]Exit code 2148734720 received from tool 'C:\azagent\A1\_work\_tasks\PublishTestResults_0b0f01ed-7dde-43ff-9cbb-e48954daf9b1\2.170.0\modules\TestResultsPublisher.exe' 
##[debug]STDIO streams have closed for tool 'C:\azagent\A1\_work\_tasks\PublishTestResults_0b0f01ed-7dde-43ff-9cbb-e48954daf9b1\2.170.0\modules\TestResultsPublisher.exe' 
##[debug]Exit code of TestResultsPublisher: 2148734720 
##[debug]Agent.Version=2.169.1 
##[debug]Agent.TempDirectory=C:\azagent\A1\_work\_temp 
##[debug]Unable to publish the test run summary to evidencestore, error details:Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, open 'C:\azagent\A1\_work\_temp\PTR_TEST_RUNSUMMARY.json' 
##[debug]task result: Succeeded 
```

It appears that the code is looking for the `PTR_TEST_RUNSUMMARY.json` but this file does not exists. I took a quick scan through the repo and can only find this instance of _reading_ the file - but not where the file is _produced_. 

### Task logs

Inline above.

## Troubleshooting
Checkout how to troubleshoot failures and collect debug logs: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/vsts/build-release/actions/troubleshooting

### Error logs

No error logs.

data.title: Azure App Service deploy for Containers sets wrong deployment information when using multiple artifacts
data.body:
## Required Information

**Question, Bug, or Feature?**  
*Type*: Bug

**Enter Task Name**: Azure App Service deploy
v4
https://github.com/Microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/tree/master/Tasks

## Environment

Azure DevOps - Release Pipeline
    
Hosted Agent, Ubuntu 18.04

## Issue Description

We are using a Release to deploy multiple App Services for Containers. Hence we have multiple artifacts linked in that pipeline. Because the task cannot properly determine the artifact_alias when using a container deploy, the deployment information shown in the App Service always links to the primary artifact - which is of course not the correct one.

The relevant source should be this: https://github.com/microsoft/azure-pipelines-tasks/blob/79ab6e9ae1562824d7cd4fb236789fb986579b01/Tasks/AzureRmWebAppDeploymentV4/operations/KuduServiceUtility.ts#L467

## Expected behavior

Even when running the container deploy, the task should correctly set the release information. If need be, this could be an extra parameter in which the user manually enters the alias name - since there is no path which contains the alias as there is for a package deployment.

### Task logs


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11445087/83890748-788bc380-a74c-11ea-8685-4e60a27ae0e4.png)


## Troubleshooting
We even tried to manually set the variable to the stage, but the task will overwrite it with "" anyway:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11445087/83890840-98bb8280-a74c-11ea-8135-31bb65196bea.png)
